title: Surveying Terms
description: Measure your knowledge of land surveying vocabulary with this quiz about the profession of measuring the Earth.

questions.question: What is a 'theodolite'?
options: A precision instrument for measuring horizontal and vertical angles

questions.question: What does 'benchmark' mean in surveying?
options: A permanent reference point of known elevation used as a basis for measurements
A bench placed at survey sites

questions.question: What is a 'traverse' in surveying?
options: A series of connected survey lines with measured angles and distances

questions.question: What does 'azimuth' refer to?
options: The horizontal angle measured clockwise from north

questions.question: What is a 'monument' in surveying?
options: A permanent physical marker placed to define a boundary point

questions.question: What does 'metes and bounds' describe?
options: A method of describing land boundaries using distances (metes) and directions (bounds)

questions.question: What is 'leveling' in surveying?
options: Making sure the tripod is straight
The process of determining the difference in elevation between points

questions.question: What is a 'plat' in surveying?
options: A map or drawing showing the boundaries and features of a piece of land

questions.question: What does 'chain' refer to as a unit of measurement?
options: A unit equal to 66 feet, historically used in land surveying
A metal chain used to mark boundaries

questions.question: What is 'triangulation'?
options: A technique using a network of triangles to determine positions of points over large areas
Dividing land into triangles for sale

questions.question: What is a 'right-of-way' in surveying?
options: The right to survey any property
The correct way to read a survey
A legal right to pass through property owned by another, or the strip of land reserved for that purpose

questions.question: What does 'topographic survey' produce?
options: A map showing the elevation, contours, and physical features of the land surface
A legal description of boundaries only

questions.question: What is a 'total station'?
options: An electronic instrument that measures angles and distances simultaneously
A complete survey of a property

questions.question: What does 'setback' mean in surveying and zoning?
options: The required minimum distance a building must be from a property line or road
A delay in completing a survey

questions.question: What is a 'rod' as a surveying measurement?
options: The pole used with a level
A unit of length equal to 16.5 feet
A metal pin driven into the ground
